title: Hackathons for Startups in Ethiopia
description: 技術系スタートアップのコミュニティは常に成長していますが、その中でCardanoとCardano Project catalystの存在を知ったのはほんの一握りです。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal suggested gives a good way of educating and providing incentives for Cardano development in start-ups in Ethiopia. It only really solves a short term problem and doesn't propose how the Hackathons for startups will continue after this initial 12 months. The budget plan seems good mentioning how the money will be used as a prize incentive.
f6_assessments.q1: It mentions use of incubation hubs in the proposal, it would be useful if incubation hubs were identified. What experience does the team have in organizing events. Hackathons are also more about the challenge, problem space and organisation not just experience in Software development. The lack of detail and unclear overall logistical plan for marketing and how they will connect with developers and startups does not give me confidence hence a score of 2 here.
f6_assessments.q2: Videos captured from the hackathons seems like a good measure of audibility, however it would be helpful if there was a better way of measuring success once a hackathon is done. For example did participants continue to use Cardano after the hackathon, how do we know that?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about organizing hackatons once a month in Ethiopia. This is a proven way to find great entrepreneur who can be introduce to the catalyst program. This proposal, if executed properly, can have add valuable proposers to the catalyst program. I give it a 5.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the idea is great, I think that hosting 1 hackaton a month may be a little bit difficult. I think that at the of each hackaton, winners should be helped proposing their ideas in catalyst. Since the challenge about introducing new proposer to the catalyst program, helping the hackaton participants should be part of the project. In the other hand, this aspect doesn't break the implementation of the project. The  road is clear and the budget breakdown seems convincing.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal contains enough detail on the roadmap as well as  reasonable kpi to be audited by the community.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
Yes. Very few people in Ethiopia know about Cardano or Catalyst.


Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
 Yes

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes. hackathons will bring lots of new proposers with new ideas into Catalyst.
 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
Yes. This includes the cost of running 12 2 day hackathons together with prizes and media expenses including cost of video production.
 
Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes by carrying out more hackathons.
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
No team members are mentioned. Proposer has not included his own Linkedin profile, FB profile, Insta profile, or any other website, YT channel or links.
 
Are these links sufficient?
No links are given 
 
Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
No 


Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
No 

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
None are listed 

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
No team listed 



Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Budget is clear, though its unclear who is going to implement it. 

IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
It is very high. There is no way to ascertain whether these are realistic costs. To me it is 37% of the entire budget for this challenge. Also they believe they will have sufficient capacity ( no of interested participants)  to run a 2 day hackathon once a month. This maybe too high an expectation considering its the first time. It would be more realistic to do 1 hackathon a quarter for one year, learn from the experience and then if it works, scale up.

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No verifiable plan for additional funds 

Have you verified this plan?
No 


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
Not really. Though the hackathons are to happen once a month, are there enough participants to compete? Are there enough experts to be on 12 juries?  


Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
The proposal idea is sensible. Can hackathons be conducted in a location considering present Covid spread?


Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes 
 


Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
No technical aspects.  

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
No roadmap is laid out other than specifying one hackathon per month for 12 months. Any plan for the training and development of the winners, ensuring they know how to prepare proposals for Catalyst would be needed, otherwise the expense spent on Hackathon is wasted.



 

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
There are no KPIs that define the success of the proposal beyond hopefully getting 120 proposals of quality to enter into Catalyst. If they are not of suitable quality then the expense on hackathons would not have a successful outcome.
 

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes


Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
The solution is understandable. Whether it will achieve the end result of bringing more proposals to Catalyst cannot be determined with surety.


Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
None are identified.
 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
No plans given

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
None

Though the problem is real and the solution is a good one, the plan does not reflect how exactly this will take place, and once its done how to ensure that the 120 plans are of sufficient quality to make it to Catalyst and have a chance of being funded. More details on the plan, links to the team, dealing with contingencies, will add value to the plan when its presented again in the future.

f6_assessments.q0: Overall, this proposal outlines a simple solution to the challenge of engaging new members in a targeted manner - focusing on Ethiopia. It also brings the benefit of delivering new ideas into the proposal pool and creating solid engagement in the developer community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal alludes to a solid understanding of the cost of the various elements to create a series of hackathons in Ethiopia. The proposal has clear objectives - running 12 hackathons - but, looking at the proposal with my many years of strategic marketing experience, I think the proposal could be improved by providing more detail on how they will create interest and engagement, whether they would target different locations each month and understand how they will build on the engagement through the year. It would also be helpful to understand how they will build validity in the event - perhaps through the reputation of their jury panels and communicating the outcomes of some of the chosen projects.

The proposal outlines the costs of the various elements for delivery, but it would benefit from a more complete project plan, with resourcing requirements and any risks added to deliver them - for example: will they outsource consistently or look to hire. Is there a risk of COVID impact, etc.

Ultimately, if there was positive ROI and engagement, I can see this as a scaleable event which can generate interest in the locations it takes place.
f6_assessments.q2:
The milestones and KPI's are well defined, however, there are no identified risks or challenges. This may be because there is a minimal risk to delivery but it would be beneficial for them to give this due consideration. A resourcing plan would also help provide context on how they plan to develop and deliver and perhaps how they could scale if it is ultimately a success.

The budget required seems acceptable for the proposed deliverables.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has the potential to potential to attrackt quality proposers and connect devs amd proposers on the ecosystem while pushing ADA growth in Africa. Good job youching multiple challenges
f6_assessments.q1: The plan could be more detailed regarding a roadmap. The budget is of sufficient detail. The proposers experience is difficult to assess as they don't give proper credentials. still 3 stars because they before have been working together with various proposers.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are a bit vague. Some measurable success criteria are given though.

solution: 効果的なハッカソンを月に2回定期的に開催し、候補者に情報を提供し、トップ5の素晴らしいプロジェクトを選出する。
experience: Full-Stack & Mobile App Eng, tested Plutus playground, B.SC in Computer Science, 4.5 years, connections to startups and incubation hubs.
